text: Apple Cider Vinegar is an Australian television series that premiered on Netflix on February 6, 2025. The series was directed by Jeffrey Walker, with Anya Beyersdorf, Samantha Strauss, and Angela Betzien writing the screenplay. Cornel Wilczek and Jemma Burns composed the music. == Plot == The series follows Belle Gibson, portrayed by Kaitlyn Dever, a young woman from Australia who falsely claims she cured a brain tumor through healthy eating and wellness practices. Inspired by the fictitious success story of Milla Blake, played by Alycia Debnam-Carey, who claims to have overcome her cancer in a similar way, Belle starts sharing health-related content on Instagram. Her posts quickly gain popularity and influence thousands of people worldwide who forsake conventional medical treatments based on her advice. The series exposes the dangerous consequences of spreading misinformation in healthcare through social media. == Cast == * Kaitlyn Dever as Belle Gibson * Alycia Debnam-Carey as Milla Blake * Aisha Dee as Chanelle * Ashley Zukerman * Tilda Cobham-Hervey * Catherine McClements == Production == The series was filmed in Melbourne, Australia, and offers insights into the real and urban backdrop of the city. "Apple Cider Vinegar" is partly based on the book "The Woman Who Fooled the World" by investigative journalists Beau Donelly and Nick Toscano, which deals with true events surrounding the real Belle Gibson. == Criticism == The series has been praised for its critical examination of the dark sides of the wellness industry, especially for Kaitlyn Dever's portrayal. However, it has also been criticized for the length of some episodes. Overall, "Apple Cider Vinegar" received 75 out of 100 points on https//www.fernsehserien.tv. == References == Category:Australian television series
title: Apple Cider Vinegar
